meanings.definition: Having the ability to resist or withstand something.
meanings.sent1: The strong metal door was very resistants to any attempts to break it down.
meanings.sent2: The waterproof jacket was designed to be resistants to rain and keep the wearer dry.
meanings.sent3: The little turtle felt very resistants when the raindrops bounced off its shell.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve to finish the marathon was as resistants as a mountain against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's shield was so resistants that no villain could penetrate it.

meanings.definition: A substance that resists a particular process or condition.
meanings.sent1: The new coating applied to the walls acted as a resistants against stains.
meanings.sent2: The material used in the experiment proved to be a reliable resistants to high temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter seemed to have a mind of its own, behaving like a resistants to the baking pan.
meanings.sent4: The ancient armor was a resistants against the arrows of the enemy archers.
meanings.sent5: The special paint acted as a resistants to corrosion, keeping the metal surface pristine.

meanings.definition: People who resist or oppose something.
meanings.sent1: The resistants gathered in the town square to protest against the new law.
meanings.sent2: The brave resistants stood firm in their beliefs despite facing criticism.
meanings.sent3: The group of resistants decided to wear matching hats to their peaceful demonstration.
meanings.sent4: The resistants were like a wall of determination against the unjust ruler.
meanings.sent5: The history books praised the resistants for their courage in standing up for what was right.
